answers.answer: Without a thorough examination it is hard to pinpoint the cause. I noticed that you have posted a number of times regarding these very same issues. Have you seen a Neurologist to rule out or diagnose nerve damage? A Cardiologist to rule out or diagnose cardio issues?Get off the computer and go see these specialist. By now you should know that posting on health forums will not get the answer you are looking for, only an evaluation by one or both of these doctors.

I get this too in the middle of the night.  I think it is associated with aging but could be bad circulation which could get worse with diabetes.  I find it eases with water.  I try to stay hydrated.  When I am sedentery and don't move much, I notice it happens more.

question: hi, i was diagnosed with diabetes last december and since then have had really bad calf pain and severe headaches , the doctor just passes it off and gives me pain killers , they do not help at all , the last few days i have got cramp in my forearms and a little numbness to the face , could anyone help me by giving me an idea what it could be..thank you
title: diabetes and calf pain
